main event: Two star-like objects were observed in Centerville, Ohio on August 21, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were observed for about 10 minutes.
The objects were described as two bright, star-like objects that disappeared rapidly after sunset.
The witness believed the objects were likely the planets Venus and Mars, which were very bright at that time.
The report concluded the objects were 'probably balloon' or 'possibly astronomical'.
No photographs of the objects were included in the report.
